person.tagline: Biomedical Engineering Technology graduate (2025) with hospital internship experience across servicing, repair, calibration, and electrical safety testing (ESA). Skilled in preventive maintenance, Philips & GE patient monitors, Dräger devices, and hands-on troubleshooting. Passionate about safe, innovative healthcare tech and creative DIY projects.

about.lead: I’m Graham Fredy Almeida, a Biomedical Engineering Technology graduate from St. Clair College (2025). My technical journey began in my family’s hardware business, where I learned tools, customer care, and practical problem-solving. I’ve since worked across pharmacy, electronics, automotive repair, and biomedical technology, giving me a multidisciplinary perspective that helps me solve challenges creatively. I enjoy the intersection of engineering, healthcare, and innovation—bringing embedded systems, soldering, troubleshooting, and preventive maintenance together to improve patient safety and care standards. I’m seeking roles as a Biomedical Engineering Technologist while progressing toward my long-term goal of becoming a Cybersecurity Biomedical Engineer.

facts.label: Strengths
facts.text: Analytical troubleshooting, high-pressure performance, clear communication, team leadership.

facts.label: Healthcare Focus
facts.text: Patient safety, ESA testing, PM schedules, compliance documentation.

facts.label: Embedded
facts.text: ESP32, Arduino IDE, MicroPython, real-time systems, sensors.

facts.label: Tools
facts.text: Oscilloscopes, multimeters, ES analyzers, soldering stations.

about.futureVision: To specialize as a Cybersecurity Biomedical/Clinical Engineer, ensuring connected medical devices are secure, reliable, and standards-compliant.

bullets: Performed preventive maintenance, repair, and troubleshooting on infusion and CADD pumps.
Worked with Philips & GE patient monitors and Dräger devices.
Conducted ESA 609, SpO<sub>2</sub>, and NIBP performance tests; documented via Nuvolo CMMS.
Collaborated with biomedical staff to ensure patient safety and regulatory compliance.
Promoted from Pizza Maker to Sous Chef; supervised teams in high-pressure service.
Oversaw HACCP compliance, inventory, and plating; trained and delegated staff.
Strengthened leadership, communication, and coordination skills transferable to clinical engineering.
Specialized in luxury vehicle electronics (Mercedes, BMW, Audi, Lexus, Toyota, Range Rover).
Used OEM schematics, oscilloscopes, and precision soldering for diagnostics and repair.
Managed customer communication and escalated complex repairs; upheld SOP compliance.
Installed CCTV and alarm systems; handled wire management and network troubleshooting.
Dispensed medicines, managed inventory, and operated pharmacy compliance software.
Maintained bottling systems; PLC and sensor checks; fault detection and reporting.
Customer service, negotiation, cash handling, and inventory management from a young age.

projects.title: Infusion IV Pump (Capstone)
projects.summary: Diaphragm-based IV infusion pump using ESP32 with LVGL display. Adjustable flow rate (mL/hr) and VTBI, IR occlusion detection, and two-way ESP32 comms for reliable control.

projects.title: Anxiety Detection System
projects.summary: Wearable Serenity Band detecting anxiety episodes via ECG and breathing sensors. ESP32 with MicroPython for real-time monitoring, threshold-based alerts, and password-protected parameters.

projects.title: NikeGs – Tech Wearable
projects.summary: Customized Nike Air Force sneakers with integrated RGB-lit logo. Circuit design, microcontrollers, and precision soldering for durable lighting without compromising comfort.

education.notes: Specialization: medical device servicing, embedded systems, healthcare standards. Key projects: Infusion IV Pump, Anxiety Detection System.
